summary: This is an email or internal memo dated July 30, 2019, documenting inmate Jeffrey Epstein's complaints and requests regarding his conditions in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). He reports issues with access to water, medication, and sleep, and expresses concern about psychological trauma from the SHU environment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a record of his complaints and requests while incarcerated, specifically mentioning his need for a razor, water, medication, and his CPAP machine, and his distress over conditions in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Doctor
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual who informed Epstein he was on Psych Observation, which resulted in him not receiving all his medications.

events.title: Epstein's SHU Complaints
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, while in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), makes several complaints about his conditions, including lack of water, missing medication, inability to sleep due to noise and lack of his CPAP machine, and fear of psychological trauma.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was held in a Special Housing Unit (SHU) as of July 30, 2019.
Epstein reported not receiving all his prescribed medications because a doctor placed him on 'Psych Observation'.
Epstein stated he had not slept well in 21 days due to the noise in the SHU and the absence of his CPAP machine.
Epstein expressed concern that he 'may get psychological trauma from SHU'.
The document records specific inmate requests and complaints regarding basic needs and medical care.
